column4: i'm hosed, Errors were encountered while processing: libc6_2.7-18lenny1_i386.deb
apt-get -f install doesn't fix it
how do i make it stop?
you are aware of the fact that you are installing a debian pacakge right?
why not take the ubuntu version of that package?
i dunno which ubuntu you run, but I assume it has that version in the repo's
I'm running karmic, this all started when I did this:sudo apt-get install mono-common libmono-winforms2.0-cil
mkay
apt-cache policy glibc6 says what?
could you run apt-cache policy glibc-2.7-1 ?
unfortunately I ran the dpkg-reconfigure -a...  so i have to finish that first?
apt-cache policy glibc-2.7-1
I think I found the problem... My /etc/apt/sources.list is way funky
that is what I was thinking (hence the apt-cache policy)
i suppose the glibc from ubuntu will install nicely
it is weird, it has references to a mirror of debian on sblug.org in it... I haven't ran debian or used sblug.org in like 6 years...
so I used this: http://repogen.simplylinux.ch/generate.php   to generate an /etc/apt/sources.list, but now when I do an apt-get update it complains about not having the keys...
easily solvable
sudo apt-key adv --keyserver $1 --recv-keys $2
replace $1 with keyserver.ubuntu.com and $2 with the KEYID
fixed my sources.list, apt-get -f install, needs to install libc-bin, then bombs: E: Internal Error, Could not perform immediate configuration (2) on libc6
